current.description: Phase 15: Jira AI Integration, External Access & Cross-Platform Deployment
features: Enhanced Jira Integration with rich AI analysis descriptions in ticket body
Automatic error category and error type mapping to Jira labels
Intelligent priority mapping based on AI-determined severity
Jira tickets now only created for critical errors (not warnings)
Gemini AI 2.0 Flash integration for real-time error analysis
Dynamic URL configuration for POS Terminal and Health API buttons
All services now bind to 0.0.0.0 for external EC2/cloud access
CORS configuration for EC2 hostnames and dynamic API URLs
Windows deployment scripts for Kafka and OpenTelemetry services
POS Demo backend migrated from sqlite3 to better-sqlite3
OpenTelemetry made optional in POS Demo backend
Vite allowedHosts configuration for all AWS EC2 hostnames
LogWatcher feedback loop prevention to reduce log spam
Environment variable backwards compatibility (JIRA_DOMAIN/JIRA_HOST)
Enhanced startup scripts with HOST=0.0.0.0 for all services

v0.9.5.title: OpenTelemetry Integration & Real-time Analytics Dashboard
v0.9.5.description: Major release introducing distributed tracing via OpenTelemetry, a comprehensive real-time analytics dashboard with live metrics, and resolution of critical frontend configuration issues.

changes.description: Real-time Analytics Dashboard - Live error rate, throughput, and latency visualization with 5-second auto-refresh
OpenTelemetry Instrumentation - Complete distributed tracing for POS Demo backend with OTLP exporter
Real-time Navigation - Added Real-time button to header and sidebar for easy access
System Health Monitoring - Health status indicator with uptime tracking and resource metrics
Active Alerts Management - Severity-based alert filtering and real-time display
Fixed Vite configuration path issue causing 404 errors in frontend
Resolved missing configuration files in POS demo frontend (index.html, vite.config.ts, tsconfig)
Fixed Vite optimizeDeps configuration to properly pre-bundle chart.js and react-chartjs-2
Resolved port allocation conflicts in start-stack.sh startup script
Fixed 504 Outdated Optimize Dep errors in browser console
Improved dependency optimization for large monorepo projects
Better error state handling in dashboard with improved error boundaries
Enhanced service startup sequencing for more reliable initialization

performance: Real-time metrics visualization with 5-second auto-refresh
Metrics aggregation latency: < 500ms
Alert evaluation time: < 1 second
Chart rendering time: < 200ms

v0.9.6.title: Jira AI Integration, External Access & Cross-Platform Deployment
v0.9.6.description: Major release introducing enhanced Jira integration with rich AI analysis descriptions, external cloud access support, and cross-platform deployment capabilities.

changes.description: Rich AI analysis descriptions in Jira ticket body including error pattern, root cause, system impact, immediate actions, AI suggestions, and long-term fixes
Automatic mapping of error categories and error types to Jira labels for better ticket organization
Intelligent Jira priority mapping based on AI-determined severity (Criticalâ†’Highest, Highâ†’High, Mediumâ†’Medium)
Jira tickets now only created for critical errors (high error rate), not for warnings or individual errors
Gemini AI upgraded to 2.0 Flash model for faster and more accurate real-time error analysis
All services now bind to 0.0.0.0 for external EC2/cloud access support
POS Terminal and Health API buttons now use dynamic URLs based on current hostname
Enhanced CORS configuration for EC2 hostnames and dynamic API URLs
Added Windows deployment scripts for Kafka and OpenTelemetry services
POS Demo backend migrated from sqlite3 to better-sqlite3 for better Windows compatibility
OpenTelemetry made optional in POS Demo backend for environments without tracing infrastructure
Vite allowedHosts configuration for all AWS EC2 hostnames including wildcard support
LogWatcher feedback loop prevention to reduce log spam and improve performance
Environment variable backwards compatibility (JIRA_DOMAIN/JIRA_HOST, JIRA_EMAIL/JIRA_USER_EMAIL)

bugfixes: Fixed Jira API 410 Gone error with improved JQL query escaping
Fixed Jira labels null error with proper sanitization
Fixed Gemini AI showing mock data due to expired API key handling
Fixed environment variable naming inconsistencies for Jira integration
Fixed external access issues with services bound to localhost
Fixed POS Demo Frontend 5174 port not accessible externally
performance: Jira ticket creation: < 2 seconds
AI analysis with Gemini 2.0 Flash: < 10 seconds
External service response time: < 500ms
Log processing without feedback loops: 50% less CPU usage

v0.9.9.title: StackLens AI Models - Prediction & Suggestions Engine
v0.9.9.description: A comprehensive AI-powered system that leverages machine learning models to predict errors before they occur, suggest intelligent fixes, automatically generate tests, and continuously evolve code quality through self-learning algorithms.

features.description: Proactive error detection using advanced ML models trained on historical error patterns
items: Predictive error detection before runtime failures occur
Pattern-based anomaly detection across application logs
Time-series forecasting for error rate predictions
API failure prediction based on latency trends

features.description: AI-driven recommendations for code improvements, fixes, and optimizations
items: Root cause analysis with remediation steps
Dependency update suggestions with impact analysis
Memory leak detection and fix suggestions

features.description: AI-powered test creation based on code analysis and error patterns
items: Unit test generation from function signatures
Integration test scaffolding from API specifications
E2E test scenario generation from user stories
Edge case test generation based on error history
Regression test generation for bug fixes
Load test scenario generation based on usage patterns
Security test generation for vulnerability coverage
Mutation testing for test quality validation
Test coverage gap identification and filling
Property-based test generation for complex logic

features.description: Comprehensive code health metrics and quality tracking
items: Code health trends visualization over time
Test coverage quality scoring (not just percentage)

features.description: Continuous improvement through feedback loops and learning
items: Automatic model retraining on new error patterns
Feedback loop integration for suggestion accuracy
Model performance monitoring and degradation alerts
Ensemble model voting for higher accuracy
Human feedback incorporation for model tuning

features.description: Intelligent code modernization and improvement suggestions
items: Design pattern suggestion for code improvements
API deprecation impact analysis and migration paths
Code smell detection with auto-fix suggestions
Dead code identification and cleanup suggestions
Caching strategy suggestions based on access patterns

features.description: Visual analytics for predictions, trends, and insights
items: Risk heat maps across application modules
PR risk scoring with detailed breakdown
Automated review comments with AI insights
Rollback recommendation based on error predictions
Feature flag suggestions for risky changes
Automated incident creation for predicted failures
Release notes generation with impact analysis

techDebt: Create model versioning and registry system
Set up model monitoring and alerting
Implement A/B testing framework for models
Create feedback collection and labeling system
